name: Meandering Muck
tagline: A maze game with infinite replayability. Just a little sticky.
description: Tilt your phone to navigate a slime through procedurally generated mazes. Two modes: Competitive (timers, trophies, leaderboards) or Cozy (just solve at your own pace).
No ads. No data harvesting. No tricks. You pay once, you own the game.

name: Salt All The Things
tagline: Two friends, two decades of WoW, and zero filter — the good, the bad, and the salty.
description: A World of Warcraft podcast premiering March 3, 2026. Two longtime players with nothing to prove and everything to say — covering current content, hot takes, and the kind of conversations that only happen after 20 years in Azeroth.
Built on a custom show planning system for episode organization, topic tracking, and guest coordination. Launching on Spotify, Apple Podcasts, YouTube, and Amazon Music.

name: Pull All The Things
tagline: Casual Heroic Raiding with Real-Life Balance & Immaculate Vibes
description: A tight-knit World of Warcraft guild for adult gamers. Focused on Heroic raid progression and Mythic+ while keeping real-life first — no toxicity, no drama, just good pulls.
Guild website with a custom-built raid roster and composition management system. Raiding Friday & Saturday evenings with a 20-player Heroic roster on Sen'jin.
terminal_desc: WoW guild site + raid roster management

name: The Fraying
tagline: A horror game that listens to your conversations and uses your vulnerability against you.
description: A horror game concept built around ambient listening — it observes what you talk about and surfaces your real-world anxieties inside the game world. The horror is personal because it knows you.
terminal_desc: Horror game that listens and learns

name: Threads
tagline: Explore a patient's mindscape across therapy sessions where the world changes as trust deepens.
description: A narrative exploration game where you move through a patient's mental landscape session by session. The world literally changes as the therapeutic relationship develops — new areas open, old ones transform, and the truth emerges in layers.

name: The Tome
tagline: Your map is alive, it has its own agenda, and it's learning to lie to you.
description: A dungeon crawler where your map is the central mechanic — and the antagonist. It starts accurate, then begins omitting things, then actively misleads you. The only way forward is learning to read between its lies.
terminal_desc: Dungeon crawler with a lying map

name: Convergence
tagline: A co-op game where you hold your partner's map in a world that's falling apart around you.
description: A co-op game built on asymmetric information. You can see where your partner needs to go, but not where you are. They can see where you are, but not where they need to go. Communication is the core mechanic.

name: Dueling Decks
tagline: A two-player card game where your deck is your life force — every upgrade brings you closer to death.
description: A card game where strengthening your deck depletes it. Your cards are your health, your resources, and your win condition — so every upgrade is also a sacrifice. The tension between power and survival is the entire game.
terminal_desc: Deckbuilder where upgrades cost your life

name: Podcast Show Planner
tagline: Custom planning tool for podcast production.
description: A custom-built podcast production planning system. Handles episode scheduling, topic management, segment planning, guest coordination, and show rundowns.
Built to support Salt All The Things and designed to be reusable for any podcast workflow.
features: Notes and research linking per topic

media.alt: Demo / screenshot of the show planner goes here

name: Raid Team Manager
tagline: Guild roster and composition management.
description: A roster and raid composition management tool built for Pull All The Things. Tracks players, roles, specs, availability, and generates optimal raid compositions.
features: Roster management with role and spec tracking
Raid composition builder with balance indicators

media.alt: Demo / screenshot of the raid manager goes here

name: sv-tools
tagline: Developer tools and automation suite.
description: A collection of developer tools and automation utilities built to support Shadowedvaca projects. Designed as a loosely coupled ecosystem with shared data schemas.

name: NPC Chatbots
tagline: A browser-based tool for writers to build and test LLM-powered characters through interactive mind maps.
description: A visual tool for writers and game designers to build, wire up, and test AI-driven characters. Design a character's personality, memories, and relationships as a mind map, then chat with them directly in the browser.

name: Book Club
tagline: Propose books, vote, schedule meetings — a full club management app for small groups.
description: A full-stack web app for keeping book clubs organized. Members register with invite codes, propose books, vote using ranked-choice or approval voting, and schedule discussion meetings with availability polling.
Built with React, Node.js, and PostgreSQL. Invite-only with admin controls for round management, member oversight, and notifications.
features: Book proposals with cover art, author, and description
Ranked-choice and approval voting with tie-breaking
Meeting scheduling with yes/maybe/no availability polling
Admin panel for round management and member oversight
Data export for full club history

name: Game Group OS
tagline: A game night intelligence platform that knows what your group knows and makes organizing effortless.
description: An organizer for tabletop game nights that tracks who owns what, who knows the rules, player counts, play time, and preferences. Suggests the best game for tonight based on who's actually showing up.

name: Wishlist
tagline: A personal wishlist tool with instant capture from anywhere — replacing Amazon, owned by you.
description: A private wishlist that lives outside of Amazon. Capture items from any store via browser extension or share link. Share with family for birthdays and holidays. Your list, your data.

name: Journal
tagline: A minimal, encrypted journaling app built for quick entries on any device.
description: A no-frills journaling app where entries are encrypted client-side before they leave your device. Fast to open, fast to write, fast to close. Built for the kind of journaling that actually happens — 30 seconds before bed.

name: Complexify
tagline: A text tool that replaces words with fancier synonyms and learns your vocabulary preferences over time.
description: Paste in text, get back a more sophisticated version. Complexify replaces plain words with elevated synonyms, adjusts to your taste as you accept and reject suggestions, and builds a personalized vocabulary profile over time.
terminal_desc: Synonym replacer that learns your style

name: Riven
tagline: A boy whose mind exists in two realities — one dying, one thriving — and only he can see both.
description: A novel concept about a boy who simultaneously experiences two parallel realities: one decaying around him, one flourishing. No one else can see what he sees. The story is about what it costs to be the only witness.

name: Tick Tock
tagline: A family discovers the old man they're caring for is a creature that feeds on fear by warping reality.
description: A horror story about a family taking in an elderly stranger who seems harmless at first. As small things go wrong and reality begins to bend, they realize he isn't aging — he's feeding.

name: Side Quest
tagline: A hero's journey told by people who never noticed the hero — each narrator is too busy being the hero of their own story.
description: An ensemble novel told entirely from the perspectives of background characters in a classic hero's journey. None of them realize there's a hero. Each one is the protagonist of their own completely unrelated story.

name: Psychic Neighbors
tagline: A grandmother's coup, a psychic cold war, and a property line that keeps moving.
description: A dark comedy about a suburban neighborhood with too many psychics and not enough land. A grandmother has decided the property line is a matter of principle. Things escalate from there.

name: Poetry
tagline: A collection of poems from a transformative period.
description: A personal poetry collection written during a period of significant change. No particular form or school — just honest writing from a time worth remembering.

name: Next Player
tagline: A physical WiFi-connected button for tracking turns at board game night.
description: A 3D-printed WiFi button that sits on the table during board games. Press it to pass the turn — it logs timestamps, tracks who's taking too long, and can send a nudge to someone's phone if they've been thinking for eight minutes.

name: Meandering Muck (itch.io)
tagline: The original game jam release, 2024.
description: The original version of Meandering Muck, built in Python for a game jam about loops. This was the prototype that eventually evolved into the full mobile release built in Godot 4.
Kept here for historical purposes. The mobile version is the definitive experience.
